parameter.name: Method
parameter.definition: Mathematical method deployed to solve the evolution of a given variable. If "operator splitting" all the processes are decoupled, the time evolution is calculated sequentially and the tendencies "cumulated". If "integrated" all the processes having an impact on the time evolution are taken into account and solved simultaneously.
Is the time stepping framework used the same as that used in the atmosphere or in the atmospheric chemistry model?

constraint.name: if Method is "specific time stepping (operator splitting)"

parameter.name: Method
parameter.definition: Is aerosol transport the same as atmospheric chemistry transport?

parameter.name: SchemeType
parameter.definition: The type of atmospheric chemistry transport scheme.

parameter.name: MassConservation
parameter.definition: How is mass conservation maintained? i) "mass adjustment": Adjustment is required to conserve mass. ii) "concentration positivity": Negative concentrations are reset. iii) "gradient monotony": Sharp gradients in concentration are smoothed.

parameter.name: Convection
parameter.definition: Convective Transport: i) "convective fluxes connected to tracers": Do tracers "see" convection? ii) "vertical velocities connected to tracers": Are the mass flux vertical velocities connected with tracers in the atmos chemistry scheme?

parameter.name: Method
parameter.definition: Is aerosol turbulence the same as atmospheric chemistry turbulence?

value.name: use same turbulence scheme as AtmosphericChemistry

parameter.definition: description of the scheme used for parametrization of the turbulent transport of aerosols.

parameter.name: Framework
parameter.definition: Classification Framework: Single Moment classifies aerosols in terms of aerosol type e.g. biomass aerosol. Microphysical classifies aerosols in terms of size bins/modes.

value.name: single moment
value.definition: Aerosols classified in terms of aerosol type e.g. biomass aerosol.

value.name: microphysical
value.definition: Aerosols classified in terms of size bins/modes. Microphysical scheme resolves the composition rather than the type. Can have a mixture of aerosol components in a single bin/mode - so can have dust and sulphate in a single mode.
